item.title: [DISTRELEC-3291] Add-Products at Search Product-Listings
item.description:
Test-Case: Call http://www.distrelec.at/search?q=iphone, Add the product 'iPhone 4 PowerSkin 1500 mAh, AP1201' to the basket -> corresponding Webtrekk-request screenshot attached

To be refactored:

1. productCost: So far '0.00' transmitted

2. cp10: According value is transmitted -> this shall only be the case when the a search-query is triggered (e.g. http://www.distrelec.at/search?q=iphone)
This would also need to be refactored accordingly for .at.

Please verify that accordingly for similar functionalities (e.g. Add-to-Basket at Onsite-Search Overlay) as well as for .it.

Thx Mark
item.environment:
* OS: W7 SP1
* UA: Chrome 31.0.1650.63 m

comments.comment: Both issues seem already to be fixed on distrelec.at. Please see the following Screencast: http://recordit.co/7yLmcaZ5by

Hi Dominic

On distrelec.at the cp10-parameter is yet transmitted (compare attached screenshot).

Thx Mark
So this issue can be closed? If not, please explain further what needs to be changed.

E.g. http://www.distrelec.at/search?q=iphone

* Currently: cp10-transmission is transmitted for all event function calls (compare attached screenshot)

* Required: No additional cp10-transmission for all event function calls

The cp10-parameter shall only be transmitted on the basis of the page-load of the search-query (e.g. http://www.distrelec.at/search?q=iphone) respectively not on the basis of event function calls (as indicated)

Bests, Mark

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3173] Missing manufacturer page redirects
item.description:
We'll look at the redirects this morning in detail. Looks like some things are wrong or got completely forgotten.

E.g. Our manufacturer shops are not being redirected: www.distrelec.at/fluke

But they were specified as far as I know.

comments.comment:
I found the problem:
The list only contains the URL https://www.distrelec.at/manufacturer/fluke but not the URL https://www.distrelec.at/fluke
Please add all URL into the files. Also the short version.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3075] Categories not sorted
item.description:
Categories are not sorted either alphabetically or in the PIM order.

Could we sort it alphabetically? It's the best otherwise customers won't find the category easily.

Can FactFinder implement it?

comments.comment:
The situation is as follows:
- The sorting currently is sequence in which we received the categories form the PIM. When a new category is added, it will be added below the existing ones.
- The sorting can be changed manually in the HMC
- The sorting is the same in all languages, with or without manual intervention.

Options:
1) Manual sorting upon import. The sorting would still be language-independent. Override in HMC not meaningful as it would be overwritten by the next PIM import. One change for all, relatively small effort.
2) Sorting on the fly upon delivery of the info. Has a slight effect on performance. Change needs to be done on all components, more effort than option 1
3) Leave it as it is, sequence categories manually by importance

Approach and possible need for change should be discussed after the go-live for the CH or ELFA release.

Unfortunately we were not able to reproduce this error on a development environment. However, we identified a code sequence were a local session is created but not removed anyomore. This issue was fixed.

Please reopen the ticket if the error occurs again.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-2881] Send to a friend: "Enter" in textfield tries to send form
item.description:
When trying to send a product to a friend by mail, there is a textfield, in which the user can type in an complimentary message.

This text field does not allow linebreaks - i.e. when pressing enter, the website tries to send the form. Even if you create artificial linebreaks (by not filling out the captcha to prevent the form from being sent), they are being ignored in the actual mail.
item.summary: Send to a friend: "Enter" in textfield tries to send form

comments.comment:
Hi Beat,

can you please take care of this bug. Thank you in advance. Dean.
Enter does not submit the form anymore, besides if the focus is on the submit button

Actually it is only half-way solved:
- enter does jump to a new line
- but the new lines are disregarded in the received email.

not critcal for launch.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3272] French and Italian Translations from the HMC, at Atos test
item.description:
Situation is the folowing:

  • Nabil imported the existing translation in Italian and French
  • all translations are in the HMC
  • on the test enviorment , nothing is shown unless
  • the labeles are searched in the HMC
  • edited, modified, saved
  • edited, delete the modification, saved

Example:

on page: https://test.a.distrelec.ch/register/b2c

Password Strength is in English

In HMC, this is translated.

If

  • edited, modified, saved
  • edited, delete the modification, saved

these words will be modified, and the translation will be in place.

Please fix asap this error, as we need to proofread!!!
item.summary: French and Italian Translations from the HMC, at Atos test

comments.comment: Could you please check this?
Pascal, according to Florian, there is a definition problem in the hMC. Please can you look at this?

it's a caching issue of the spring message properties. the values are loaded to memory at the time they were english.

reboot of the server will help.
Please reboot

Hi,

item.description:

item.summary: Registration Confirmation Mail: Button not showing correctly

comments.comment:
In the content area, the button "jetzt bestätigen" is distorted.

All other issues of the printscreen handled in linked tickets.
Hi Lukas, Please can you check for this email and also all the others. Thank you.
Bitte für 1.0_AT fixen

Hallo Beat,
Das html scheint grundsätzlich in Ordnung zu sein und wird auch nicht vom Outlook manipuliert (wie es z.b. der gmail Webclient macht). Möglicherweise lässt sich das Problem beheben, in dem das inline css für den Button auf das td Element geschrieben wird, das den Link umgibt.

1) I cannot test outlook

2) outlook has the worst styling support of all email clients

3) there is no way to style the link for outlook without affecting the styling in all other email clients

4) I only have 2 suggestions that might improve the link styling in outlook, Lukas please test:

a) add to table inline style: mso-table-lspace:0; mso-table-rspace:0;

or b) remove the table around the link button (affecting all email clients).

suggestions above had no effect, however, i found another solution that seems to work for outlook and gmail webclient:

add "nowrap" to the <td> and move the background-color from the <a> element to the <td>

<td style="border-collapse: collapse; background-color: #de1417;" nowrap>
<a style="display: inline-block; padding: 11px 10px; text-align: center; vertical-align: middle; text-decoration: none; border: 1px solid #de1417; color: #ffffff; white-space: nowrap;" href="${ctx.orderUrl}" target="_blank">${ctx.messages.buttonText}</a>
</td>

Do you have any concerns about this solution?
if it works, please use it.
Nicht-Klicken still there...

item.title: [DISTRELEC-2257] 9 Teaser-Tracking --> incomplete Teaser-requests
item.description:
FE-task - pre-discussed with Dominic at the meeting dated 6th Dec.

Unexpected behaviour (so far):

  • View-request: Only values from the first teaser-element are transmitted
  • Click-request: On click on a teaer-element no Teaser-request is transmitted
  • OS: W7
  • UA: FF 25.0

comments.comment:
1st Webtrekk-feedback in this regard:

schaut mal auf die Attribute.
Ihr habt eienrseits die Eigentschauften (JSON-Objekt) auf dem name-Attribute definiert und andereseits in der JS ein anderes Attribut definiert das verwendet werden soll „…data…“.
Das kann nicht gehen.

Reply from Dominic regarding 1st Webtrekk-feedback:

Hallo Mark

Dein Code Ausschnitt ist von der Hero Teaser Komponente. Die funktioniert aber bereits wie Sie soll. Das Problem ist der Carpet. Anbei ein Screenshot vom Carpet Code:

Es gibt hier also kein JS und alle Items sind sichtbar beim Laden der Seite. Frag doch bitte beim Entwickler noch einmal kurz nach und leite ihm am besten meine Email weiter.
Wenn wir dann nicht weiterkommen können wir gerne einen Call machen.

Viele Grüsse Dominic

A direct contact to the teaser-plugin developer seems to be 'difficult' at to moment according to Webtrekk

2nd Webtrekk-feedback in this regard:

Hilft das: Das ist die Config bei euch im Plugin: "teaserAttribute" : "data-wt-teaser" (vgl. angehängter Screenshot)

Im HTML steht name=…. :

Laut Konfig suchen wir aber nach data-wt-teaser. Da wir data-wt-teaser nicht finden wird nichts erfasst.

...

MDI: Ist ein neuer Input von Webtrekk und war so nicht in der Plugin-Doku spezifiziert. Demnach bitte das 'name'-Attribut für das Teaser-Tracking durch 'data-wt-teaser' ersetzen.

Hallo Mark

Es funktioniert!

Habs in allen Modulen von Kapitel 9.1 & 9.2 angepasst, siehe https://wiki.namics.com/display/distrelint/Webtrekk+-+Frontend+Implementation

Beim Carpet — Bei Pageload wird der zusätzliche wt Event getriggert und enthällt alle Teaser die du tatsächlich auf deinem Bildschirm sehen kannst.Wenn du dann nach unten Scrollst werden weitere wt Events gefeuert für die Teaser die neu ins Bild kommen.

Beim Hero Teaser — Das erste Item (Position 3) wird getriggert so wie beim Carpet. Klickt man nun durch den Hero Teaser werden per Javascript weitere Events ausgeführt. Ich muss beim Hero Teaser aber noch etwas anpassen, da manchmal ein falscher Event verwendet wird. Danach erst setze ich das Ticket auf resolved und gebe es dir zurück.

Was mir aufgefallen ist: Wenn ein Event mal nicht gefeuert wird, hilft es wenn man ein bisschen Scrollt!

Super - danke für den Hinweis. Freut mich, dass wir damit einen grossen Schritt weitergekommen sind.

Bests, Mark

Carpet is ok.

Rotating Teaser (Product Detail Page) is ok.

Carousel (Product Detail Page) is ok. The Carousel is now loaded via Ajax (was a performance issue) that's why we needed to change the implementation.

The new manual Carpet Component that is filled from top to botton, column by colum has different position parameters than the other components. Positions go from top to bottom and than to the right instead of from left to right and then down.

Hero Teaser: The one item that is visible on pageload should automatically be tracked. In my test, the wrong element is transmitted. I added the ckv param to that element, but it is transmitted anyway..

Hi Mark

The issues described in my latest comment my only be an issue on my local machine. Basically this ticket is resolved. However please test the teaser tracking once it is deployed and report back if some data is not correctly transmitted yet.

Thanks!

Hi Dominic

I) Regarding the Hero-Teaser: At my machine the pos.1 element is initially shown for approximately half a second (no teaser-request transmitted) and then directly the element with the pos. 4 (first teaser-request transmitted - compare screenshot).
Please investigate why no view (ck523) is tracked (blue-marked on screenshot) for the pos. 4 element. What I have recognised, is, that the pos. 4 element is the only one where the ckv-parameter is not set.

II) Carpet (compare two screenshots attached): There seems to be an issue regarding the Position Value (twice a value of '6' transmitted). An element does not contain an according teaser-tracking.

Thx Mark

  • OS: W7

* Event 'cart' --> on product detail sites missing as second request (e.g. compare http://test.distrelec.ch/en/Windows-7-Home-Premium-ita-Vollversion-1-Microsoft-GFC-00142/p/11062288)

1) Event Cart: This event is already implemented and only needs to be activated. But it is only implemented on the Toolsitem Cart Button (the icon one with the 8 corners) and not on normal Buttons. This means on the Product Detail View, a Click on "Zum Warenkorb hinzufügen..." does not trigger an 8.2 Event.

2) There was a bug which is now resolved.

3) Should already trigger an Event, see the attached Screenshot showing the two requests.
See comment, just call me if you think its easier to discuss over the phone.

4) Regarding 'Event Cart' (-> referring to 'toolsitem.skin.cart'):

--> In terms of Toolsitem Cart Button (the icon one with the 8 corners) the additional event is e.g. not triggered so far for 'Meta HD Flyout Search'

5) Generally please implement the additional event also for normal Buttons (Suche Global, Product Detail View, Meta HD Flyout Search, Compare View, BOM Manager, Shopping Lists)

6) Event 'Shopping Lists /shopping' (-> referring to 'shoppinglist-meta-actions'): So far not working

Thx Mark
4) Added 8.2 Event Tracking to Meta HD Suggest. Resolved.
6) Cannot reproduce. Was the event that maybe not activated? If the issue is still there, please describe it in more detail.

5)

Implemented:

√ Product Detail View (Buying Section)
√ Meta HD Flyout Search (Same as in 4)
√ Compare View
√ BOM Manager (Add to Cart und Add to List Buttons)

//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

Not Implemented:

- Suche Global

Please define Tracking ID and which Button exactly should be tracked.

//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

Was already implemented:

- Shopping Lists

Please define Tracking ID and which Button exactly should be tracked.

5) Okay (as discussed on phone: 'Suche Global' = 'Meta HD Flyout Search')

6) Event 'Shopping Lists /shopping': Event is activated and executed. However, the request is so far not poperly (aborted) transmitted. I have shortly looked into this: It seems that a pagereload is generated onclick. Question: Is 'sendunload' accordingly considered for the event?

Thx Mark
6) Okay. Which Event do you mean? "Add a new Shopping List" or "Add all Items to Cart" or another one?

6) The event 'Add a new Shopping List' is meant.

Mark

6) The problem here is the same as in another ticket: The event is fired, but not completely because of the following page load. The specification said, that sendOnUnload would make this possible, bis it does not work. As far as I know, we do not habe the possibility to track this event.

Hi Mark

Please see my latest comment. Unfortunately, I think this can not be tracked. But you could check back with your Webtrekk Contact and ask him, if he knows a solution to track something by Javascript with an immediate page load.

Please compare E-Mail dated Montag, 3. Februar 2014 09:09

Ciao Dominic
 
Danke für dein Feedback bezüglich DISTRELEC-2648 bzw. -2194.
 
Wie von dir erwähnt werde ich das gerne umgehend mit unserer Ansprechperson bei Webtrekk anschauen. Ich habe mir dazu den Quellcode (base-Js) angeschaut. Könntest du mir bitte kurz angeben, auf welche Js-Funktion sich z.B. die Klasse 'btn btn-primary' (bezieht sich auf den Fall 'req-snd') bezieht?

Ciao Mark

The best way to see this issue is in the form-feedback module. Suche dazu im File "http://www.distrelec.at/_ui/all/cache/base.js" einfach mal nach "Tc.Module.FormFeedback". Dort passiert nach einem Klick auf den Absenden Button folgendes:

1) sendForm() wird aufgerufen
2) sentFormSuccessful() wird aufgerufen
3) trackEventFormSent wird aufgerufen
3) webtrekkEvent wird gefeuert, was "onWebtrekkEvent" aufruft im Modul "Tc.Module.Webtrekk"
4) wt.sendinfo(webtrekkObj) wird aufgerufen

Diese Details musst du aus meiner Sicht aber gar nicht so genau verstehen. Wichtig wäre nur zu wissen, ob man einen Tracking Event auslösen kann, wenn danach ein PageLoad folgt. Aus meiner Sicht geht das eben nicht.

Move Implementation to on site link.

Rename onWebtrekkOnSiteLink to onWebtrekkEventWithPageLoad in webtrekk.js. Only used in newsletter subscribe so far.

Even if I put the following code directly into the HTML of the Newsletter Subscribe Button, the Request does not seem to be transmitted. You can try and add this via Firebug into the Markup on test.distrelec.at and see it for yourself.

onclick="wt.sendinfo({linkId:'ch.ons.test.-',sendOnUnload:1});"

Hi Dominic

As far as I know Webtrekk Js-functionalities need to be fully and properly initialised during page-loading. That is why a Markup-test within is not working in this regard via Firebug 'from scratch'.

A analogous working example (onclick-event Webtrekk function-call) you can find as following: https://www.distrelec.ch/home (click on promobox - compare attached screenshot).

For an according Hybris-testing please setup a 'onclick="wt.sendinfo({linkId:'ch.ons.test.-',sendOnUnload:1});"'-example on a test-environment (test-page) in order to test the Webtrekk-behaviour on the basis of a givne page-load.

Thx Mark

Hi Mark
Okay good to know, but I already tested this and I tested it now again putting the following link tag in the JSP:

<a href="https://distrelec-ch.local:9002/my-account" onclick="wt.sendinfo({linkId:'ch.ons.test.-',sendOnUnload:1});">Test</a>

I also tried the one from the current Distrelec Homepage Promo Teaser. There must be another issue. Is maybe a certain plugin not activated or included in the webtrekk v3 Javascript file?

item.title: [DISTRELEC-2407] Penetration Test Outcome
item.description:
Compass Security perfomed the penetration test on the test.distrelec.ch environment from 17.12.-20.12.13, software version: 0.5.6, released 13.12.13

Note that even if they found that the web shop is based on a solid infrastructure, Compass Security considers the security level of the new web shop as insufficient! Major tickets will have to be fixed before golive.

Multiple critical vulnerabilities which —when combined—pose a critical threat to the new web shop.

It is possible to inject and for some fields even store own script code into the web shop at different locations (e.g. search field, shopping list or feedback form). This could be used to attack another user with a
crafted request. This is a so called cross-site-scripting (XSS) attack where the code is executed after clicking or visiting a prepared link. This code gets executed in the context of Distrelec's website within the victim's browser. Since the output is not properly encoded, the browser executes it instead of showing it as pure text.

Combined with a missing protection of the cookie (special token used by the server to authenticate the user), an attacker could perform an XSS attack and steal her or his cookie to login with the victim's account. The credentials aren't leaked with this attack, but the adversary is able to impersonate the user with all his permissions.

Furthermore, authorization bypasses were found on different locations allowing an attacker to edit addresses of any other user, to change the budget limit of himself or have subusers create new users which are then owned by himself and he also become a more privileged user.

A further critical vulnerability is the missing random token, this Anti-Cross-Site-Request-Forgery (CSRF) token, in all the requests. Without this token an attacker can predefine a link for an action (like to create a user) and have a victim click on it. This would immediately trigger the action directly since no random token ensures anti-forgery.

With all these vulnerabilities combined for different scenarios, it's possible to gain access to every account, change various user settings and execute orders on behalf of others. Both, the XSS and the CSRF attack depend on the victim clicking on a prepared link.

comments.comment: Rene, can you please scan through all the sub-tickets and check if there is anything for us that is not currently assigned to us. Thank you.
Find attached the complete Compass report report_81554_daetwyler_webshop_secassesment_v1.0.pdf

Hello David

Patrick asked me to make a recommendation on what do be done before the go-live.
But some of the issues do have an impact on the usability of the application
and therefore the decision has to be done by Distrelec.

Can you please organize a meeting?

Thanks
René

Hallo René,

As the last open item reported as high-risk from Compass is Cross-Site Request Forgery (DISTRELEC-2443) which can be addressed with the WAF I won't organise a meeting to look at the other ones in the near future (we have enough on our plate).

I sent the status to Daniel Gisler awaiting on his feedback, but as already mentioned the only big issue left is DISTRELEC-2443 but as we have the same issue in the current shop we should be able to risk 2 weeks without protection (not going live would have the same impact).
